# Pipe

**Class**

A one-way communications channel between related processes.

## Declaration

```swift
class Pipe
```

## Overview

[doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Pipe] objects provide an object-oriented interface for accessing pipes. An [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Pipe] object represents both ends of a pipe and enables communication through the pipe. A pipe is a one-way communications channel between related processes; one process writes data, while the other process reads that data. The data that passes through the pipe is buffered; the size of the buffer is determined by the underlying operating system. [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Pipe] is an abstract class, the public interface of a class cluster.

## Getting the File Handles for a Pipe

- **fileHandleForReading**: The receiver’s read file handle.
- **fileHandleForWriting**: The receiver’s write file handle.

## Tasks and Pipes

- **Process**: An object that represents a subprocess of the current process.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSObjectProtocol
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
